entity.name: Great Canal Journeys
entity.description: Prunella Scales and Timothy West embark on canal journeys together, traversing the canals of the UK, Europe, and the rest of the world by canal barge and narrowboat. Their trips take them along many scenic waterways, including ancient routes followed by the Vikings in Sweden, the windmills along the canals near Amsterdam, and the route once taken by Casanova in Venice. Along the way they interact with interesting characters, taste regional dishes and explore the sights around the canals. Sheila Hancock and Gyles Brandreth host the twelfth season.

tweets.text: @bill_brierley @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland Interesting. I joined Twitter in Oct 2015. Feel free to show me a single Tweet since then when I said anything at all critical of those "Hard working and dedicated people who are trying to protect the environment"?

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text üëá https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

Prepare.Act.Survive @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/LvAlgXA6Hl https://t.co/2ZEQgfD1c1

Do you know what to do in a flood? Make sure you know the simple steps to take if a Flood Alert, Flood Warning, or Severe Flood Warning is issued in your area üëá

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/sXatK90YWd
We're excited to be joining Mike Baxter on the @Recoup_UK webinar as he hosts @EnvAgency, @NFUtweets @Cleanfarms and @TIPACorp On Thursday November 19! https://t.co/5wZl8RUWIh

NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ

And our final talk was from @GeorgiFauconier who showed us some amazing images of Microsporidia in European #smelt. This was work done with @ZSLScience @NHM_London @EnvAgency @GarethDDaviesEA @Bruneluni https://t.co/elZF5eAWQo

Well said Lee. 

And it‚Äôs not just @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency also have been cut to the bone. https://t.co/HYcc3fBIQs

urls.title: Guest blog - 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting, by Miles King - Mark Avery
urls.description: Miles King has written regularly on this site. His previous blogs and more information about him can be found here. Twitter: @MilesKing10 Berrier Farm under Trees: 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting. England desperately needs more trees, we are constantly told. And it‚Äôs certainly true that tree cover here is lower than most other European countries. The data must be handled with care though, when tree cover can include anything from Eucalyptus plantations in Spain, to Sitka
